definitions.definition: to send an electronic signal, radio or television broadcast, etc.

examples.text: The ceremony was transmitted live by satellite to over fifty countries.
a short-wave radio that can transmit as well as receive
Movies can be transmitted over the internet.
The data will be automatically transmitted from one part of the system to another.

definitions.definition: to pass something from one person to another

examples.text: Parents can unwittingly transmit their own fears to their children.
The disease cannot be transmitted through coughing or sneezing.
The infection can be transmitted from a mother to her baby.
The virus is easily transmitted via needles.
the study of genetically transmitted diseases

definitions.definition: to allow heat, light, sound, etc. to pass through

examples.text: Steam only transmits heat when it condenses.
This chapter explains how sounds are transmitted through the air.

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin transmittere, from trans- ‘across’ + mittere ‘send’.
